texts.definition: Additional information presented when players have focused on a game element.
markups: <style="Definition">Additional information presented when players have focused on a game element.</style>

This pattern is a still a stub.

''Note:'' this pattern exists in many design pattern collections for interaction design. However, being related quite specifically to information it can affect gameplay more directly than other interaction design patterns.

The <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Civilization%20(video%20game)%20series">Civilization series</link></style> provide <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> regarding the resource generator of terrain when players let mouse pointers hover over them.

Most of the game elements in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearts%20of%20Iron%20series">Hearts of Iron series</link></style> show some <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> when focused upon.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style> makes use of <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> as well, but allows players to choose from having ''beginner'' <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> or ordinary ones.

<style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> are a way of providing information to players in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer%20Games">Computer Games</link></style> by adding text overlays on things they focus upon, so they imply a use of <style="Link"><link="mediated-gameplay">Mediated Gameplay</link></style>. Besides deciding what game elements should have <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> and what information should be provided, the main design choice in implementing the pattern is how long time one has to focus before the <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> are shown. What players are focused upon is usually a simple case of checking what their <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="crosshairs">Crosshairs</link></style> are pointing at.

While <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> in games typically provide information about the gameplay, they may also provide <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Extra-Game%20Information">Extra-Game Information</link></style> regarding the game interface or other ways of playing the game.

<style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> is both an <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Information%20Patterns">Information</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Interface%20Patterns">Interface Pattern</link></style>. However, the appropriate time before showing <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> can vary depending on the type of gameplay and a distinction can be made between presenting only <style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> for game elements or for interface components such as menus and buttons.

<style="CurrentLink">Tooltips</style> provide <style="Link"><link="clues">Clues</link></style> to players and can help players handle <style="Link"><link="complex-gameplay">Complex Gameplay</link></style>. They modify how <style="Link"><link="crosshairs">Crosshairs</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> work by making them tools for getting more explicit information from games, even if this comes at the cost of introducing ephemeral <style="Link"><link="non-diegetic-features">Non-Diegetic Features</link></style> and thereby potentially breaking <style="Link"><link="diegetic-consistency">Diegetic Consistency</link></style>. By doing so they can let players have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Smooth%20Learning%20Curves">Smooth Learning Curves</link></style>, as well as letting game designers have concrete ways to share their <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style> to them. This <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style> can in turn encourage players to engage in <style="Link"><link="strategic-planning">Strategic Planning</link></style>.
